description: Located in the heart of the mission. Walked in around 4 PM, no other customers in the store and 3 to 4 woman behind the counter, all said hello very friendly and very attentive. The women who helped me had no problems answering questions. I purchased two dozen of the wedding cookies and four chocolate eclairs which were delicious. The wedding cookies are just one of my favorite cookies made at this bakery..  The two dozen of wedding cookies did not even last one full day in our home!! Definitely this is one of the best bakeries that I go to.
author: Diana P.

description:
This old-school bakery makes a very good first impression the moment you walk in the front door because all their freshly baked confections are all on display at once (photo: http://bit.ly/2QeGrUa). It's kinda like "The Bachelor" where all the women are gorgeous as they present themselves in revealing evening gowns to the vacuous single guy, but then they open their mouths and well... So I've been on calorie alert for a while, so as tempting as it would be, I can't order an entire St. Honore cake in order to devour it at home.

I was strolling on Mission and smacking my lips thinking something sweet would be nice. I zeroed in on their cookies where my eyes bugged out at the sight of the Amaretti with Pinoli (Amaretto Cookies with Pine Nuts) (photo: http://bit.ly/2wQvdMI). Two of those, please. And tilting my stare to the left, I saw the tray of Almond Lunghini (Italian Almond Cookies) (photo: http://bit.ly/2M8Cm0s). One of those, please. OK, I need to stop now. Three cookies for $3.75 seems s tad high but who cares? You should leave the gun, take the amaretti. Tutti a tavola a mangiare!

COOKIES - 4 stars...delizioso!
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nowhere to sit but such a nice place to browse
SERVICE - 4 stars...no-nonsense
TOTAL - 4 stars...has Lidia and Grandma been here?

RELATED - Need to satisfy a sweet tooth? Here's a list of places I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2KaTJwA
author: Ed U.

description:
Awesome store!! This place has Italian ladies who make the pastries...this is the real deal. 

I picked up some tiramisu and napoleon cakes. It was so good, I went back a few days later. This time it was the rum cake and Federetti which is an almond cake with chocolate mousse covered in chocolate. Heaven!
author: Sunil R.

description:
I got a slice of the tres leches pineapple cake and another pastry. The tres leches was a bit stale and was not milky like other cakes I've had. 2/5 

I'm not sure on the pastry's name but it had a yellow custard inside it and was flaky on the outside. This was actually pretty good. 4/5 

For just those two items, it was $9.50. I don't mind supporting small businesses but that was pretty pricey in my opinion especially for a below average cake.
author: Sherluna V.

description: I was craving something sweet while strolling along Missing District so decided to swing by Dianda's for an afternoon treat. There were so many choices of sweets! I picked out the raspberry pocket, chocolate biscotti, and plain amaretti. The raspberry pocket and biscotti were good but the amaretti was outstanding! The amaretti was a bit crisp on the outside and had a chewy texture on the inside. I'll return for the amaretti alone but looking forward to trying out more Italian sweets.
author: Ruby C.

description: I was walking by this place and came in because of the amazing smell. The desserts look heavenly, and I really wanted to love this place but they don't have any vegan options :( I guess it's for the better since I only live 1 block away and would come here every day.
author: Keala L.

description:
3.5 STARS 

As I was waiting to pay for a cake:

Guy: "I think we should get married."

*Points at wedding cake topper*

Woman: "Awww, really?!"

Me *thinking*: "GUUUURRRLLLL, LOCK IT DOWN! LOCK. IT. DOWN!!!!!"

Ok, I know what some of you are thinking: Who proposes in a bakery...without a ring?!

For those who have dated commitment phobic men, you know what's up.

Forget the 2 carat minimum, I'll gladly take the ring from the gum ball machine! 

I don't know if he was being serious, but if he was...good to luck to the happy couple. 

Our intern was leaving and our secretary found out her fav cake was Tres Leches Cake. After a quick search on Yelp, I found that Dianda's was highly praised for their Tres Leches Cake. The cakes aren't fancy, they're old school, Aqua Net style but seem to be a crowd pleaser. 

Cakes orders require a 3 days' notice but I called in 2 days prior and they accepted my order. So, if the cake order is simple, you may not have to call in 3 days in advance. A deposit is required for all orders.  

I ordered a Mango Tres Leches Cake which was $37.75 and feeds 8-10 people: http://bit.ly/2mRQRLj. The 3 layers of leche: milk soaked sponge cake, custard, and whipped cream was rich and sweet but the mangos were slightly tart so everything kind of balanced out: http://bit.ly/2FUo5m3. 

Not really my style as the soaked sponge cake tastes just like it sounds, like a wet sponge but for those who like tres leches, I'm sure they'll feel differently. My co-workers said, they liked it (or maybe they didn't want to hurt my feelings).   

For cakes, my preferences are Fancy Wheat Field Bakery (San Bruno Avenue), Schubert's (Clement Street), Ambrosia Bakery (Ocean Avenue), and Tartine (Guerrero Street).

They spelled our intern's name wrong so I suggest asking them to repeat the spelling twice just to make extra sure. 

If anyone has another recs from Dianda's, kindly send them along. Maybe, I'll even see another "proposal"!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: This is a historic place for cakes and bake goods in the Mission District. So many delicious treats. My favorites are the Italian pastries they are so amazing. No special occasions can be complete without Diandas.
author: Juan V.

description: They have a huge variety of cake and cookie flavors. I got the tres leches cake slice and it didnt taste like tres leches at all. I was disappointed because it looked really good! It wasnt moist at all and sort of tasted like it was from a grocery store. I would give the place another try and try a different flavor though!
author: Auriyon J.

description: Perfect place to grab some sweets while your friend waits for you in that long line at La Taqueria haha. Their cakes are perfectly sweet and moist. My top 3 picks here are the almond tort, cannoli, and tiramisu. They have so many different options to please everyone. Even cartoon cupcakes for the little ones. If you come here early mornings be prepared to wait in line.
author: Mary R.

description:
This place serves REAL cakes!   

I had to wait in line for 30 minutes but it's totally worth it.

I got the cappuccino chocolate cake.  It's 46 dollars for the smallest one. I personally think the chocolate chocolate cake was the best.  The almond tort and the almond cookies are also my favorite.

Love this Italian bakery. It's a true gem in the Mission district.

Parking around the bakery is tough. Make sure you put enough coins in the meter so you won't have to pay for the parking ticket. The metermaid is circulating around this area very often!

The best cake is at Dianda's   Highly recommended!
author: Ivory B.

description:
I've had diandas bookmarked for awhile,  I'm always on a quest for new dessert spots to add into my rotation. 

The ladies who work here are super sweet and friendly, there's no line of any sort, you go up to the counter and tell them what you want. 

I'm fond of all sorts of cookies, hard ones soft ones and in between. The Italian cookies i got here were hard as a rock but freaking delicuous and addicting.  I also picked up a cannoli, it wasn't as large as mikes in Boston but very filling for the price.  It wasn't super sweet either, but half of one satisfied me. 

Must come if you're in the mission and craving some sweets.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Never had heard of this place and I didn't have it bookmarked either but I saw a bunch of people inside so I decided to hop in....

Three popular items are: 

Napoleon -made by sandwiching crispy layers of puff pastry with a rich custard pastry cream filling. This dish was amazing !! I liked this considerably more than the almond tort. First time trying it. 
Almond tort- was not my thing. Def liked Napoleon more and I'm sure I'm sure I would have liked the cannoli more.
Canolli looked good but didn't try it

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake

20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake

26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes

31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description:
Me and my coworker had just wrapped up a work visit and walking back to BART when we noticed Dianda's.  She was raving about the Almond tortes so we stepped in for her to get some.  I wasn't going to buy anything until I saw all the chocolate goodies.  I gave in to the temptation...

Got an eclair, brownie, and the fedotorii.  The fedotorii was beyond delicious.  Chocolate covered rum mousse with an almond crunch base.  I had a chocolate overload.  The almond torte my coworker bought back to work the next day was amazing as well.
author: Karen L.

description:
Dianda's is located a few steps away from the 26th street Mission BART Station and is just a gem when it comes to Italian pastries and sweets. Their best items are still their almond cookies - especially the ones with the pinolas or pine nuts. Yum. 
The fedoretti which is in the refrigerated section - a cake coated in chocolate and oozing with richness is to die for. The dulce de leche and other cakes are simple but am sure they're amazing too. Dianda's is worth many visits when in the city and especially around the Mission where good food is plentiful and a true commonality.
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Someone brought in their world famous almond torte at work.  OMG it was a slice of heaven.  Not too sweet and the cake wasn't dry either.  They were very generous with the almond as well.

Dianda's makes the best pastries!
author: Wendy H.

description:
Love this stuff. I have searched high and low in other states (I travel a lot) and I have not been able to find anyone who can match this place. On my last visit I brought some pastries to bring back on my flight, they gave frozen pasties and dry ice, I was so happy but as I was packing for my trip, I eat them!   Oh well! I tried.  
It is definitely worth the price! Parking sucks but it is so tasty, you won't care when you are eating your pastry.
author: Liz B.

description: Stopped in for some cookies for the kids and they had a great time choosing from all the delicious looking things behind the counter. We ended up with an assortment and they were all so good. My sister loved the tiramisu and I loved the almond cookie- it was so soft and chewy. Grabbed a cup of coffee and took our cookies to go! Reminds me of the cookies my grandma would bring home from the bakery in NY.
author: Francine B.

description:
Unfortunately, this isn't the Dianda's we I have known and loved as an institution of Italian American pastries in the Mission. 
If you remember this place from years ago and the original owners,  then you know what I'm talking about. This place isn't bad, but not as good as, it was before. The prices have sky rocketed. I mean $19.00 for a lb of wedding cookies. Last year their Almond raspberry torte was $14.25 today it was $19.25 a $5.00 hike in one year. The cakes they are known for, if not ordered in advance,  then you are out of luck. I mean these cakes were what put them on the map. 
A small cake 4-6 servings $55.00. If you don't order in advance,  they will pull out a frozen one if they have it ( make you feel like you should be grateful you're even getting one).  The same as their eclairs if not out one from the freezer.  The prices are just not worth the quality it use to be. To bad.
author: Myra A.

description:
OMG - how come they don't have a branch where I live - geez - amazing!
When i'm in the city I come for their famous almond torte - OMG so good.
But when I went in this time I wanted to buy about 10 other pastries - couldn't do it - wouldn't travel well and my pics to NOT show their scrumputness - but if you are nearby - you MUST go here.
amazing!
author: Tina O.

description: Scrumptious. Mouth-watering. Perfect. My husband ordered for me a freshly made dulce de leche cake. I ordered for my husband's fortieth a banana cake with vanilla frosting and filling. Their pastries and sliced cakes are out of this world.  Thank you for the memories.
author: Petite M.

description:
If there's one thing I know it's cake. 

I mean I know a lot about a lot of things but the one thing in this entire universe I am so super confident about in my real world experience of eating, making, baking, gifting and being gifted ...cakes would be it. 

I love cake. I love cake more than wine, whiskey, cheese, books, breakfast, a parking spot in SF, and the color pink. 

That is a LOT of love! 

The St Honore cake everyone raves about is good. The Italian cherries are lovely, the depth of chocolate is really nice, the boozy levels are too high for me. This is a difficult cake to make for the home baker when you take apart the individual technical merits/skill level you need coupled with the price of the quality ingredients this cake demands. Reminds me of making an Opera cake. Same demands on ones skill, time, and cost per slice. 

SOLUTION: BUY IT HERE!! My personal taste in no way reflects badly on the quality. It's definitely there. This is a stunner and others who like punchy obvious flavors in their mouth will love, no, worship this cake! 

But for those of us with refined, discerning taste. Let me steer you to what is easily the most elegant non-European cake I have had the pleasure of eating more than one slice in a sitting.

The Banana Tres Leches cake. 

Fresh bananas, wonderfully fluffy whipped cream, cake with a firm but tender crumb (to stand up to the soaking), and a base layer soaked in cream that isn't flimsy/doesn't fall apart. This cake is a visual and gastronomical delight!

The perfume of fresh bananas, the fatty cream and whipped cream, coupled with the texture of the cake make this the perfect choice for a special event (or if you are like me, a weekday) This doesn't keep so order a size that you will completely finish in a day.

If all that cake-loving talk wasn't enough praise, the cookies! I love Stella D'oro cookies from the market. I like the circles with pink or white frosting. Cheesy? Yes. Throwback to my childhood? You bet!

The same flavor can be found in the cookies here. Better quality cookie, more tender crumb, lovely Italian cherries, chocolate, and or nuts grace the individual varietals. Get a pound of cookies, brew some coffee, and take some time out of life to savor your alone time. 

I still grab a bag of Stella D'oro's when I see them but let's not tell lies here. That slide out box of store bought cookies pales in comparison to the freshly baked deliciousness the cookie case here boasts. 

I just love sweets. My gosh. 

I love this bakery. They completely justify my love for cake and everything that requires butter, flour sugar, eggs, leavening, and an oven. 

Five stars - well done!

PS: You can phone same day to order a cake for pick-up. My family did. It was easy peasy perfect!
author: Jennifer C P.

description: My childhood cake place, always a cake from here for my birthday, lately it's been hit and miss, the product doesn't seem or taste fresh, dried out cakes and the prices are gong up, up up.
author: IRMA C.

description: Got the chocolate cake with rum. Taste was nothing special at all and cake was dry. Could do better with other bakeries offering cakes at the same price range. Probably won't be back.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I love Dianda's! The bakery has an amazing assortment of traditional baked goods that are perfect for every occasion and reasonably priced. I'm happy there's a true old fashion Italian Bakery in SF!

My favorites:
The cannolis, Napoleon, Chocolate mousse, cream horns, both vanilla and chocolate cakes with fruit, and the cookies. 

The staff could be friendlier for sure. It's always super busy whenever I come here, but a smile and a thank you would go a really long way. 

Definitely visit if you're in the area!!
author: Angel R.

description: We normally order the famous Dianda cake with cream puffs but this time we ordered chocolate cake with banana filling and OMG was it the best!!! Perfect sweetness, not too sweet and fluffy moist cake with a light whip filling  perfection
author: Lea G.

description: I love their 3 leches cake yumm! But they need to expand their flavors. How about kiwi? Either way highly recommend!
author: Rosana C.

description:
Super nice ladies! And they have a great variety of cakes, pastries, cookies, etc. I was walking in the area and remembered that they were known for their tres leches cake. They were out but I put in an order for a few slices to pick up tomorrow - yes, you can put in an order to reserve just one slice of cake. 

And the slices were boxed up for right on time today. Sadly the cake was completely unrecognizable as a tres leches cake. Fluffy cake, light whipped cream frosting. But where are the tres leches? The cake was not soaked in any liquid at all and BTW the whipped cream doesn't count as one of the tres. I tried a few bites then was turning the box around trying to look for the name to make sure I got the right cake. The order receipt looks like it could have 'pineapple 3 leche'. Looking over other yelp reviews it seems like this is indeed the worst tres leches cake.

However, the Italian cakes are on point and really good.
author: Jean K.

description:
Dianda's has some pretty good cakes and pastries. They have a few locations in the Bay Area.
This location has always had great cakes.
I have tried a lot of there rum cakes and tiramisu. They are fantastic.
The price is about $35 for a cake. You are paying for a high quality cake. 
This location has a loading zone to park in front since it's on mission st which is very busy.
The staff was friendly.
That accept card here.
Check it out!
author: Kevin S.

description: Loveeee this bakery!! The thousand layers cake is the best! Have to call in and order a day before for it. The quality is good and price is decent! Only down side is parking! Very hard to find parking on mission but then again it is in sf!
author: MV N.

description:
Blandest cannoli ever! I came here with so high expectations and I was completely disappointed! We had cannoli and brownies and both in our opinion were tasteless. Also, really overpriced.
Definitely we are not planning to coming back.
author: Michelle C.

description: Who doesn't like a little cannoli served with Italian flare? A very cute bakery in the Mission that serves up all sorts of Italian delectables. We tried their cannoli which was quite delicious.
author: Kenson K.

description: I've gotten my bday cake here since an infant now I get my children's cakes here. I recommend the rum cake with the custard balls it is amazing
author: Raymo G.

description:
Best bakery in SF. Everything is beyond delicious. Hope to visit soon.
If they still have the St.Honore cake, don't miss it,unforgettable experience!
author: Bridget R.

description:
I got to try their almond torte, and it was awesome. I'm a big fan of marzipan and anything almond.

The crust is a very thin pastry crust, and then there's a thin layer of raspberry jam.  The cake itself is super almondy, and it's fairly light but moist.  The texture is great.

This is one of my favorite almond tortes.
author: Marilyn H.

description: I can't say enough about Dianda's. Being a native this Bakery is one of the hearts of the city! Service is solid and the pastries and cakes are superb!
author: domenique c.

description: Ever since I can remember my family has been getting dianda's cake. I honestly will never get tired of eating their cakes for my birthday. It has become a tradition for my family to always come here for birthdays. I even try to introduce it to my close friends and every time they have tried their cakes they want more. My usual must try is the chocolate chocolate. I eat this for basically all my birthdays. Another cake that comes in second is the tres leeches just because I'm Spanish and love tres leeches. They have other cakes like pineapples and strawberries + more fruity ones. The staff is always super friendly and bilingual! Cakes do range from 35 dollars + and single slices around 4 dollars. The wait isn't too long and they have the cakes ready for you to pick up and write whatever on it that you would like. It is really hard to find parking because it is on the mission but sometimes you can get lucky with meter parking! Overall best Italian cake in SF And one of the best cakes I've tried period.
author: Leslie F.

description: A wonderful surprise! This is a cute little bakery, tucked away in a small strip mall near crystal springs. It's small and quaint. The service is fast. The desserts are delicious!!! Their Napoleon is the best I've had in all of California!! They are famous for the into an desserts, mainly this cream puff cake they make. I haven't had it but it looks and sounds amazing!! You must try this place!! It's incredible!!
author: Vicki K.

description: My family has enjoyed Dianda's for over 40 years (I've included a picture to prove it)!!!Did I just date myself??!! They have a such a delicious assortment of fresh pastries to choose from and honestly, I can't say any one choice is better than the other because you simply can't go wrong with anything. Okay, there is one slice you MUST GET, it's what they're known for...the RUM cake. Ay mama!!!
author: Monica B.

description:
Conveniently located next to the best burrito you'll ever have in your entire life, Dianda's was a logical next stop for us on our trip to SFO. We took cannolis to go, the most beautiful sprinkle cookie, and various other cookies and biscottis to go. The cakes were picturesque but we did not try them. 

I have never had a cannoli before but I heard that it was pretty good!
author: Jayci G.

description:
Best Italian cake in California!

You have to taste it to understand why this bakery is so good​ and expensive.

Cakes can range from $40-100+.

A slice of cake is now $4.25 which is probably not expensive to the influx of techies who moved into the Mission, but it hits the pockets of the loyal natives who have been there since day 1. 

Small families can't afford expensive cakes. It's also the size. Basically your average cake for 15 people is around $25, but Dianda's could set you back $45-$70 depending on what cake you get. They go from a 12 inch round to massive cakes.

Best cakes.
Strawberry. However, the last time I got a slice, the strawberries seemed hard . There was something different. It wasn't the same cake I'm used to.

Banana.
Lemon
Pineapple.
Chocolate.

They have a new flavor: tres leches and pineapple. Hmmmmmm. Not sure. Will have to try that another time.

I think it's the whipped cream, too. It's soft, moist and tasty.

Dianda's get 5 stars for taste, but 3 for pricing.
author: Angela B.

description:
Dianda's is another member of the old school SF bakery family.  Victoria, Schubert's, Stella, Dianda's.  The bakery where every SF native (especially if they're Italian) goes for their cakes & cannoli.  I love Tartine, but that's not where they're going to go for cannoli, you know what I mean?  We're talking old school.

Their St. Honore cake is the only cake one of my bf's will have for her birthday.

Their rum cake is the only cake my man actually likes.  Really, he's just not a cake guy.  But Dianda's rum cake?  He's all over it.

Anything w almond they do like poetry.  The almond torte has a HUGE following.  Apparently, the tradition is every Christmas you ship this almond torte out to your loved ones.  So, what I want to know is...where's my Christmas almond torte?  I've never received one...?!  I'd like an almond torte via special delivery...who wouldn't?

Naturally, I've lamented this to my man.  So I should be getting one delivered to me right before December 25th.  

They were sold out of rum cake.  So we got Mexican wedding cookies, almond coconut cookies, & the almond puff pastries that look like mini biscotti.  With one fedoretti.

The fedoretti...
an almond pastry base topped w a chocolate rum cream & covered in chocolate.  It's wonderful.  We noshed it before we got to the car.

On the way out, I spotted the patty cakes & the strawberry rolls.  The patty cakes are chocolate cakes filled w whipped cream and covered in chocolate.  That just sounds amazing to me.  2 of my favorite things together in one heavenly piece of work.  The strawberry roll looks positively dreamy.  

Next time.  
It's on.

Over 50 years old & still a must do.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Tried a chocolate rum cake from Dianda's and it was absolutely amazing. You couldn't feel too much rum in it but just a hint of it's taste. Would definetly recommend trying out.
author: Gaurav N.

description: Cake boss has nothing on this bakery!!  Wonderful selection and tastes are out of this world!!  Great customer service too!!
author: Janet G.

description: Wow. I feel fortunate to live a block from this place. Tasty cookies and quality cannoli. I haven't sampled the famous rum cake.
author: Tim P.

description:
My colleague requested the St. Honore as her special (office) birthday treat and it was terrific!   mmmmm, me love me some custard!     It was the perfect size, beautifully decorated and arrived in a timely matter.   I've never heard of this cake before and was pleasantly surprised how yummy!

The delivery fee is $20 but was well worth not having to leave the office to get it.
author: Nicole D.

description: My boss is Italian so I decided to surprise him with a birthday cake from Dianda's. They were so helpful over the phone, picking the most incredible cake. It was whip cream with Mango. It was ready right on time and while I was there I even got myself a little personal size cake for later.  The whole office was raving about this cake it was a huge hit!
author: Chris C.

description: Saw the sign and walked in after lunch next door. It smells like heaven inside. Had a hard time choosing but got a few things up go. One item we asked for was not in the box when we got home later, no idea if we were charged for it,oh well. There were 2 young lady's working that didn't seem to enjoy their job. I had questions as I had never been there  and was kind of excited to try some of their items, I didn't appreciate the eye rolling. So 5 stars for the pastries, minus one for the staff.
author: Samantha H.

description:
Honestly never heard of this place until my friend asked me to help her pick up the cake but wow, I've definitely been living under a rock....

This bakery is located in the Mission so be mindful about how tough parking can get as the streets get pretty busy. Metered street parking all around but there is residential parking if you're willing to walk a bit. 

I noticed that you're supposed to take a number in order to get helped faster(?) but there was no more numbers left to take when I got there lol. Regardless, the service was fast and extremely helpful! I was in and out of there within 10 minutes, on top of them writing something in frosting on the cake! 

Now, I didn't get to try their other baked goods but the strawberry short cake is to DIE for! It is so moist and filled with fresh strawberries and soft whipped cream all around. Please, you just have to get it!
author: Coco L.

description: After damn near 30 years of coming here, I have never had a complaint until now. Thanks, Maria for the absolutely, disgusting, unexcusable customer service. I don't want to waste too much of my time writing details. However, I will call her out by her name so that people know. Tip: if you want to place an order for pick up, make sure they actually MAKE your order. They wasted my f*****g time!
author: Alma F.

description: My family has been buying pastries from here since before I was even born since I can remember we have always bought cakes from here for my younger sister and my birthdays also for special occasions like Mother's Day. If you are looking for yummy rum cakes or delicious cannolis this is the spot. I no longer live in San Francisco but when ever I'm close by I make sure I stop by and buy a few pastries to take home to my family. Something about the cakes that with just one bite it brings me back to my childhood growing up in the Mission District of San Francisco.
author: Claudia R.

description:
Stopped by for a tiramisu cake for the holidays. Cake was good, but the service was poor. We asked for writing on the cake, and the associate took it to the back to write. He then boxed the cake without even asking us to take a look. When we asked to see it, we found out that he really messed up the writing. The writing was illegible, not completely frosted, and left icing-less holes in the cake. His excuse was that the cake was hard and it wasn't easy to put frosting on it--- which I'm not sure if thats referring to his poor handwriting or the holes in the cake...

He then kept rushing and badgering us asking for us to pay with cash. We had to ask twice before he would use a credit card. After that we wanted to get some cookies, and he made us pay for them separately in cash. 

I would give the place 3.5 stars for the cake, - 2.5 stars for the bad service.
author: James S.

description:
My coworker ordered a cake from them for our annual Lunar new year lunch. The cake was frozen, only part of the cake had rum on it, the wording was not centered and who ever decorated the cake obviously think it was ok to be sloppy by correcting the color that was on top of one of the cream puff by smudging the correct color on top of the wrong one. 
Disappointed by this experience...
author: Sty S.

description: I've been to Dianda's many times, but never tried the St. Honore cake. Was going to a friend's for Christmas Eve, so decided to order one. Was worth the difficult parking, and line of people. Was "hands down" the best cake I've ever had. Rum custard, whipped cream, oh my! Everyone loved it! Can't wait until my birthday!! Dianda's is amazing!!!
author: Lynn G.

description: Nice traditional Italian bakery.  Their almond tort is very nice and fresh.   Also a wide range of assortments of Italian cookies to select from!
author: Tkd K.

description: Tres leches? This is definitely not a tres leches cake . I was saddened to have all my hope and dreams crushed by this dry cake. This is more like a yellow cake with some whip cream and some fruit filling in the middle. Sad!
author: Selena H.

description: WOW! The pecan tart was delicious. Picked up a pecan tart and a slice of cheesecake. Just the right amount of sweetness in the tart. The dessert was a great compliment to having dinner next door. I hadn't had the cheesecake in years and it is still very moist and delicious. Highly recommend this place for any dessert needs.
author: Jackson T.

description: I love this place nice cakes and all kinds of good Italian pasties in the heart of the Mission. My family enjoyed this place for years, the staff is super friendly and I always get my cakes on point ! I recommend the St Honroe cake! I get those cakes for work when it's a farewell occasion!
author: Pooh W.

description: Recently I bought a muffin. I asked the woman behind the counter if was from today. She said yes , but the muffin was so old and dry I had to throw it away.There were not enough blueberries in it.Is not the first time I buy pastries from them and are not fresh. Is not cheap to buy from there, I expect the product to be fresh.
author: Maria s.

description:
I can't believe i haven't reviewed this place. My mother in law introduced me to this deliciousness about 9 years ago and still love their pastries. 

i took away stars because their workers are RUDE AS HECK!!!!! You ask them what flavor things are and they give you the attitude and the stare. It would help if they had labels on their cases. But their pissy attitude hasn't and will not stop me from getting my Dianda fix. 

ST. HONORE cake is and will be the best cake I've ever had. One time my husband and I purchased their small $40 round of St. Honore just to take home and enjoy. No birthdays, no occasion. If i lived closer this would be my husbands and my birthday cake every year. 

I suggest people not care about their poor customer service and just try their pastries. It has gotten pricier over the years but you will not be disappointed.
author: Chrissie G.

description: I went yesterday to order a cake for my sons birthday, I was told by a friend that they make delicious cakes and had what I was looking for... a custom cake. First I called and ask if they could do that and the lady over the phone said yeAh just bring the picture and we will do it... I went over an immediately saw a lady arguing with a customer and she was very rude... when it was my turn i told her that i spoke to someone over the phone basically 40min ago and she didn't even let me finish and said No we don't do that plus we don't have the material and it was so rude, I asked that o wanted to speak to the manager and she said the manager is on vacation and not coming back until February 3rd... I walked out really mad and customers told me that that two younger ladies are the rudest and that manager will be there next day in the morning... they need to get new people to this store since the only thing is messy are the worker!
author: Sandra L.

description: My family and I have been buying our cakes from here for years now, since I was a kid ive always had a cake from here. Super yummy!
author: Kristy G.

description: Just had a cannoli, didn't  really enjoy it. Should've spent my $4.50 on my fave mushroom puff or rum cup intead of the dinky cannoli.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: Unfriendly wait staff, the young short girl at the counter that is.  Not a smile or a hello.  Just an order-taker and that's it.  Desserts r fine, good, but I've had better cannolis.  Would've given 4stars if she wasn't such a negative Nancy.
author: Jill P.

description: This is my favorite bakery ever. My family had been loyal customers since 1979. Thank you, Dianda's!
author: Pessi M.

description: These are a tradition for my family, love the strawberries and cream because real strawberries!!
author: Rebecca S.

description: Millefiori is the cake I look for any excuse to buy. A birthday, communion, barmitzvah, kid lost their first tooth whatever. It's flaky like baklava and filled with a fresh cream. Take it to your girlfriends parents the first time you meet 'em, tell 'em it's a Italian specialty cake
author: Greg Poupon M.

description:
Popular pastry shop right next to the Bart Mission-24 stop

This quaint little pastry store always seem to have more customers than there is space. The chocolate, cookies, and cakes all looked fresh and colorful, and the staff who work there all seem to be pretty nice. The price is ok--reasonable given the quality. I ordered the cherry and raspberry cookies, which were a bit dry, but hey, I expected cookies to be dry anyways :)

If I needed to get a cake for a special occasion (e.g. birthdays etc), I would definitely go grab a cake from this place.
author: Henry L.

description:
I don't know why I would never have gotten to complete a review for an outstanding place of business that I have frequented many, many times in the past several years. And by all accounts, consider it my favorite bakery on the Planet...  DIANDRA'S ITALIAN AMERICAN  PASTRY.  It even has two locations. One  is in the Mission District, San Francisco (the most popular) and secondly the other location is in San Mateo (which is where I live now).  I've got Yelper buddy Cheryl S to remind me just how AMAZING this bakery really is, as she took her very first visit there just recently and is HOOKED. That's what this place does to you!  It also brings back many childhood memories for me.  My Mom use to always make us tag along as she would go shopping for dinner parties (she was an excellent cook) I can remember she always ended the shopping extravaganza with a stop at Diandra's.They have a huge selection of pastries, cakes, and cookies.  I was also so very fortunate to receive a St Honore Birthday cake for EVERY birthday.  Boy was that a TREAT!

To this very day, I find myself at Diandra's. Instead of bringing a bottle of wine for a dinner welcome gift, I usually stop at Diandra's and pick up a box of cookies, which they sell by the half of pound. They are like gourmet cookies. They also sell Napoleons, which are my favorite,  tied with, of course, the St Honore Cake.  They also sell Cannoli's, slices of cakes, Tiramisu, cream puffs called "the clam", almond torte, and cream horns.  During Easter, they even sell the wonderful Hot Cross buns. If there's a word that could describe something much more than DECADENT and/or SCRUMPTIOUS, Please tell me.... Because that would describe Diandra's.  Forget Schubert's or Victoria Pastry....  Diandra's is truly a GEM!  

YES they are expensive, the ladies behind the counter ROCK. But ohhhhhh... So worth it.

Try it, you won't like it..... you'll absoultely LOVE it.  Ask my friend Cheryl.
author: Janet T.

description: I have tried the tres leches cake from here and it is my absolute favorite! Today we were hoping to buy a piece but they were already sold out. So we went ahead a tried a new flavor a banana cream. Omg... it was delicious! Seem like you can't go wrong with any flavor. And did I mention the price for a slice? Only $4.50 you can not beat it!
author: Jeannette C.

description: Best Italian bakery in Northern CA. I've been coming here for over 20 years. The rum cake is my favorite, but the banana and chocolate is also so good. Cookies and canolis are amazing.
author: Marlene M.

description:
One of the best bakeries in SF! Been coming here since I was a kid. They have the best rum balls, napoleons, cakes, etc. If you want a special cake, I'd suggest the St. Honore cake which has rum balls all along the edges. 

Much easier to call and reserve cakes at Dianda's rather than other popular bakeries such as Schubert's etc., as the latter only takes orders on weekdays.
author: Ana Marie L.

description: Once upon a time I tasted the BEST thousand layer cake at Dianda's. It was so delicious that after every bite I would close my eyes and savor this perfect pastry. It been a long while since I had one until today. I was utterly disappointed! Something was off...it had a very thin layer of whipped cream on top with very small chocolate shavings. It needed more whipped cream so it can compliment the custard. The custard was not the same either. Not rich not delicate a bit bland. Something changed from this thousand layer cake and not for the better. If I remember correctly it may have had layers of whipped in between the custard layers and this one did not have any. Unfortunately, I will have to live with the memory of what the thousand layer cake used to taste like at Dianda's because it is a distant memory.
author: Review L.

description:
I really love this place. The cake is not too sweet -  it is perfect taste!! And the price is ok :) 

If you have a chance to visit around here. I would recommend to taste it....
author: Pinarat S.

description:
Today is my sons birthday. I have been ordering strawberry whip cream and mango wip cream cake for over 15 years my family has been customers of your establishment for 20+ years . I picked up my cake order with the wrong colors printed on my cake I specified for no dark icing. My order was mango  cake with whip cream I order this several times. My son has a severe nut allergy we opened the cake to sing happy birthday n the cake has nut shavings on the bottom of the cake. So now my son has no cake on his birthday. 
Sent from my iPhone
author: Lolo L.

description:
My first time at Dianda's was yesterday. I went in to pick up a cake for my coworker's birthday. I specifically wanted tres Leches. They had a variety of choices! Strawberries, Pineapple, Banana, and even Mango! 

The cake was nice and moist. Their custard was light and palpable. I'm usually not a fan of custard so this is a high compliment. 

The decoration on the cake is old fashioned but tasteful. Over all I'd say I had a pleasant experience. I think I'm lacking the nostalgia that others have for this place. After all I'm an L.A. raised gal, but all in all 4 stars!
author: Judith G.

description: As the world changes around it, Dianda's stays true to form. I've been coming here for almost 30 years. The cannolis are still perfect, and the Napoleon is a revelation disguised as a cake. Yeah sure, so the prices went up, so did everything else in the City. Just be happy that this, and many places like it, still exist. Places like this are what define San Francisco. I hope that I can take my grandchildren to get their birthday cakes there just like my grandparents took me.
author: Robert K.

description: We have gotten several birthday cakes from here since back when I was a kid in the 80's. Their Cakes are sooooooo yummy. This Is definitely one of the best places to get a cake from. The Napolean and rum cakes are the best I have ever had.
author: Soraya M.

description: We have been buying their cakes and pastry for the last 45 Years. Had three children and countless birthdays and anniversaries. Never had a complaint or a bad product. My opinion the BEST!!! And we have tried many.
author: Juana S.

description:
This Bakery is an authentic Italian-American pastry shop from fresh Danish pies to Classic desserts on to full-on cakes and Artisan breads you can sit and have coffee or you can pick up and take to go during the whole year they have different seasonal items traditional pumpkin strawberries banana you name it they have it through seasons the ladies who work there are very nice answer questions.
Hall fresh-baked danishes every morning pies and artisan bread.
 this place I recommend I know the prices are  fare because you're paying for quality if you want to spend less money for poor quality then go to Safeway or Albertsons you won't get to the freshness there. 
All items are brought daily from their San Francisco sister properties store in the city!
author: Thebay A.

description:
Fantastic Italian run cake, always incredibly busy.  Impossible to park. They really need a "curb delivery" option.  Driving around for 20 min and parking 4 blocks away when you have a heavy cake is really difficult. 

I would love to give them my credit card over the phone and have them run the cake out...

Do that and you'll get 2 more stars.
author: P K.

description: If I'm craving wedding cookies (snowball cookies), I come here. They are the most buttery of any I've tried in the city.
author: Alexandres M.

description:
My first experience (there have been several more since) with Dianda's was somewhat mixed. A coworker had brought in two large boxes with a selection of most of their cakes, and I, in my greed, decided it was wise to attempt to try every single one of them. Sugar, cream, and carb overload ensued twenty minutes later for this clever lactose-intolerant Asian.

Highlights? Definitely their chocolate strawberry cake and their tiramisu, both of which were pretty fantastic. Their banana cake? Not bad, if you're into bananas, but I certainly prefer mine in pie form. Their rum puff cake, alas, was a little disappointing.

Texture wise, their cakes are all of the sponge variety: so, nice and fluffy. Prices are also quite reasonable, given the portion sizes! A solid 3.5 stars.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Your typical bakery with display cases all around. Theirs are of the shorter variety, so one can easily see the top shelf, as they're roughly eye level, even while sitting. When they're busy, it does get a little cramped, but for the most part, maneuverability isn't an issue.

Bathroom - Pretty sure I didn't see any open to the public.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I'm surprised there aren't more reviews for this place.

This bakery has been a favorite of the lady since she was a kid in the Sunset. She turned me on to the rum balls and the mushroom pastry thingy. When you put both of those together, come up with some pretty funny set ups to surprise your friends.

The prices are a bit on the higher side so I'll knock it down a star but the quality of the pastries are in the upper echelon levels.
author: Art O.

description: I don't know why this place has such high ratings. Their cakes are outdated and lacks that certain quality.   If you look at the designs of the cake you can see that they look like cakes from the 1970s/80s.  Well, that's what they taste like too. Their other pastries, again, outdated.  Scroll through the photos on yelp and you'll see what I'm talking about.  I've tried this place three times just to give them a chance but Was left disappointed every time.
author: Urban E.

description: Went here twice with the girlfriend and we both loved it. They have a great selection to choose from and do custom orders too. The smell alone is worth the price of one of their awesome cannoli. The run cake is amazing too!!! Check it out!!!!!!!
author: Taylor P.

description: Great customer service and delicious treats. Best St. Honoré and rum cakes. Cakes always available and ready for pick up. Great for those last minute invites.
author: Dee Q.

description:
My family and I have been buying cakes and pastries here for probably over 30 years. We used to buy everything at their location on Green St in the North Beach and when they closed, we started buying at this location.

Unfortunately, this 30 year tradition ends today. My mother called me last week to ask me what kind of cake I wanted for my birthday this year and I specifically asked for a chocolate cake with strawberries from Dianda's.

My mom placed the order on Thursday for pick up on Sunday. She arrived early in the morning only to find out that the cake was not there. Instead of expressing concern and trying to make this right, they all decide to interrogate my mother and treat her like she's an idiot. 

First they told her that someone already picked it up which was impossible because only 2 people knew that the cake was there, myself and my mom. Then they started interrogating her as if she was lying. They asked her how big the cake was, how many servings it was, how much it was and so on. I mean really? I understand asking what kind of cake but to ask her the rest of the questions was unacceptable. 

Then they accused her of placing the order at the San Mateo location. My mom told them repeatedly that she did not. They did not believe her and they called over there anyway and low and behold, no such order was placed there.

Then it finally occurs to them to look at the receipts and it looks like they gave our cake to someone else by mistake. So after over 30 minutes of harassing my mom, they just grab another from the case, write on it and pack it. There was no apology or discount for loosing our cake.

So a few hours later, here we are getting ready to cut the cake and my mom makes a comment to me that the strawberries look really old and dry so I'm looking at it and I see that the strawberries are moldy. We then cut it open to see and the strawberries are equally as disgusting and they are brown and leaky. So we put all of it back into the box because the last thing I want to do is get sick and we go back to dianda's again. 

Also, there is no way that they didn't see this. The baker actually took the cake to the back to write on so they were fully aware that the fruit was old and moldy but yet chose to still sell it to us.

When we get there, my mom begins to talk to one of the ladies. She tells her about the rotten cake and another clerk chimes in and actually says to us that it is no moldy. My mom picks one of the strawberries up so they can take a closer look and one of them actually acknowledges that it is indeed moldy. So the clerk tells me she is going to get me another cake and I tell her that I don't want ANOTHER cake and that I just want a refund.

Another clerk chimes in and tells me that the manager is not in until tomorrow. I mean really!?! So you want us to come back a THIRD time? I live like 25 minutes away from here and tomorrow is Monday and people work. Also, it's not like I just didn't like the cake and want a refund even though they should refund your money or replace it under those circumstances too. The cake was rotten for God's sake! So that is when I started to talk and get really upset. 

I told them that this was unacceptable and that after they lost my cake, harassed my mom for over 30 minutes in the morning that their solution was to replace my lost cake with a rotten one. And that instead of being at home with my family celebrating my birthday, I'm here dealing with them.

All this time there was an older Italian lady with a really nasty attitude was just listening to what was going on even though I know she is affiliated with the owners and definitely had the authority to give me my money back. Because I was so upset, getting loud and customers were starting to listen, she finally stepped in and literally tossed the money at us and made a snarky remark that she gave us 25 cents more. WOW! 25 cents was totally worth TWO trips across the city, dealing with the difficult parking, having my mom treated poorly for 30 minutes, a lost cake, a rotten cake, ending up with NO birthday cake, having to get really upset before getting a refund, having the money tossed at me like we were a piece of garbage AND me having to take 1.5 hours out of my birthday to deal with this. Thank you so much for your generosity. I don't know what I would do without that extra 25 whole cents. What a bitch!

After 30 years of buying a ton of cakes, after recommending them to all my friends and family all of these years and being one of their biggest supporters, it's a shame that it had to end this way. I will never ever step foot in this place again and I have already begun reaching out to my network to tell them what happened to us and that I don't want them buying me and surprising me with anymore cakes from here.

Luckily, I live in SF where bakeries are a dime a dozen. Schubert's and Ambrosia are about to get a lot more business from us and I don't have to drive all the way out to the mission.
author: Diane M.

description:
I like this lil place and their tasty lil sugar delights. I usually hit up this place after I fill my tummy over at Chavas, and it's the perfect ending to the meal. 
Their cookies are always bomb and I make sure to pick up some for my parents as well. 
I'm especially fond of any kind of almond cookies they have. 

This place can get kinda of crazy so make sure you take a look around before they help to make things go a lil easier.
author: Em C.

description: Grew up celebrating our birthdays with delicious cakes and pastries from Dianda's Italian Bakery... Can't say enough about their variety of freshly baked cakes, pastries and cookies. My favorites are the St Honore cake with little eclairs filled with custard, the raspberry almond torte, the Zuppe Inglese rum soaked vake with custard filling between layers of flaky pastry, all their cookies and my favorite candy...caramele Rossana in the red wrapper, hard candy filled with a yummy sweet cream center.
author: Mo B.

description: The canoli's here.. TO DIE FOR! If you are in the area, you must stop by and grab one (ok, maybe 2-3) ...
author: Meg S.

description: Best biscotti in the City by far.  Get an assortment of mini biscotti in a one pound box (fun retro box tying machine by the way).  Fruit and almond biscotti are great too!  Enjoy.
author: Tony D.

description: Grew up on the cakes and pastries here. Even after moving hours away I try to go whenever I'm in town
author: Karla M.

description:
Too bad they closed their North Beach bakery years ago.  You have to get down to the Mission for this place.  Love their puffed pastries.  So good, filled with custard, whipped cream and all sorts of flavors. The choc. eclair isn't so great 'tho and the creamed horn (with whipped cream) isn't too bad.  

The rum cake slices are great too.  Truly a city gem and some of the best cakes you can get for birthdays.   If parking wasn't so horrible and Dianda's so far, I'd be here more often.
author: Ry T.

description:
I grew up in Queens NYC, till I was high school age. There were lots of Italian and Greek bakeries and restaurants all around Ditmars Boulevard, as there still are today. Yum!

Dianda's in the heart of The SF Mission brings me back to the Italian neighborhoods of NYC, where you might need to count "Frankie's" on a typical "block" with two hands and not one. You know what I mean?  Dianda's bakery has stood that test of time, having been in business over 50 years. It's a fast moving, all bakery, kind of place.  Don't expect a Vienna style bakery and wait service or restaurant. Wait in line, get your stuff to take it home or to the park.

How are the baked goods, you ask?

Very nice, and the best part for me was the large selection of cookies. Cookies, cookies everywhere. The recipe's are good, and the unique flavors of say Anise Biscotti, will make you want to brew up the classic Italian Roast again and again. In fact most of these cookies are perfect coffee cookies. 

Dianda's is especially a place to search out around the holidays, as we did for our Christmas dinner. Make sure you get two things, one for immediate satisfaction, and the second thing to make sure your holiday feast ends with a special flair. Then get on the treadmill later on.
author: Frank O.

description: I love the patty cake. The staff is also always really helpful. I sort of hate that it's so close the Bart because I keep going in on my way home. But that's on me.
author: Adaobi N.

description: The Chocolate Rum Cake & Cannoli's are to die for! My dad loves the chocolate rum cake....he drives to SF every year to get one for his birthday! It's totally worth the drive!
author: Manette S.

description: I have a personal connection to this bakery... Birthdays, Weddings, Graduations or just to buy a cake... they've always been bought here. To say I love this place would be an understatement. I'll keep this short and sweet like their Rum Cake cups. Dianda's is hands down the best Bakery in San Francisco!
author: Maria Francesca A.

description:
I love pastries so when I heard about this place I had to try it out. They have a huge selection and it's located next door to La Taqueria. Knocked two birds with one stone. I wanted to try both of these places one weekend and it was a one stop shop for me! 

You can really taste their flavor in the pastries. I was craving more after I finished it all. We ordered basic ones too. I didn't get to try the cakes but no worries I will be back. I ordered a bunch of cookies from their selection but those weren't as good as the pastries. I liked how it was a an old school bake shop, there aren't too many of those anymore. Reminded me of a bakery I used to go to when I was younger. 

Mmmm pastries!
author: Dara S.

description:
This place is not only the one place my family consistantly buys cakes, but it was also my first yelp review. I was inspired to start reviewing places by writing about my favorites. Now years later and at almost 900 reviews, I'm fully addicted.

Dianda's cakes are the real deal. Growing up in both a Italian and Latin American family, I grew to appreciate good food and the culture behind the food we eat, order and make. I appreciate the food that is not only the best, but has been for decades. 

We grew up on years of Dianda's cakes and wanted to share that with my guy. He loves canollis and my cousin was having a birthday dinner. I used the opportunity to stock up on sweets. 

I purchased a large beautiful rose cupcake with heart sprinkles and petite fours for the whole crowd. (Since we brought our own dessert to the restaurant, we kept the cakes bite sized) I also bought canollis and a giant heart shaped sugar cookie for my sugar. 

Still Dianda's is the best place to buy our birthday celebration desserts, because you and your loved ones are really worth the best.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Amazing, rich, creamy, and just a perfect slice of dessert! Coworker brought in a large cake from this ever popular Italian bakery in the Mission. A bit of a softer NY style, thick and dense, but generally a tad softer in the creamy center.

Not a huge fan of the profiteroles here, or the Italian cookies, however. It's more the texture for me.
author: Jana C.

description: Love their cannolis, cakes, cupcakes, and every cookie (chocolate biscotti is bomb). They have good rum cake too. Just like the desserts the staff are really sweet people and are hard workers since they get really long lines sometimes so keep that in mo. Tambien hablan español y siempre me acuerdo comiendo cookies de diandas cuando estaba chiquita con mis hermanos y comiendo los queques con my familia.
author: Frances A.

description: Favorite neighborhood pastry shop in the Mission. The pastries are so delicious and the bakers are always so friendly.
author: Joan I.

description:
I've been to Dianda's for over twenty years.

Yesterday, I bought four items (4 dollars each). 

I was most disappointed with the custard clam.  Some Yelpers call this item a custard puff but it's really more of a giant pastry clam with lots of custard in it.  Sadly, it's not as good as it used to be.  There were half as much custard and the custard itself was not creamy but more like overcooked cream (too dense and sweet).  I think they cooked the custard too long because that is how custard tastes when you cook it and condense it too long.  The shell or clam pastry didn't have that nice crispy sugar coating it used to, it was slightly soggy and doughy.  My memories of this perfect pastry has died.  I think it's because over the years, they have different bakers and this baker just isn't very good.

The original rum cake is pretty because the strawberry red color is the actual rum and it has custard in it.   Hubby thought it was good but messy to eat since the cake is topped with a hard pasty shell that shatters.  We also had the Napoleon which is layers of light crispy pastry with custard in between.  Sadly, the Italian Napoleon doesn't taste half as good as a Chinese Napoleon.  If you go to a good Chinese bakery in Chinatown, try their Napoleon because there are nuts in it and special sweet crispy layers that reminds you of a candy bar inside.  Hubby liked the Napoleon the best but that's because he hasn't tried the Chinese version yet.  

Don't let the size fool you, these pastries are huge but they are super light and not very sweet so you can inhale them.  Unfortunately,  I found all of the pastries sitting out on the counter a little too long, it didn't taste fresh enough.

I got my parents a slice of mixed fruit cake and yes, they did like it.  The pastries are all very pretty here so if you want to impress someone, buy a few pastries and get a box which is complimentary.  My four pastries came to 16 dollars but they do take credit card.
author: Lorissa W.

description: Dianda's bakery  was referred to us on behalf of our venue as a package deal . However, we didn't go through the package and decided to look around first but nothing compared to the taste and quality of diandas cakes. The cakes are a bit pricey but very well worth it ! We ordered a 5 tier cake of chocolate rum I believe and it was delicious ! My only down fall was that at the time of cutting it, it would not cut so easy but besides that the cake was beautiful and tasted great !
author: Patricia A.

description: This is not like a true ITALIAN bakery, we went all the way over there based on reviews to pick up a N.Y. cheesecake and a rum cake, needless to say once we got to Dianda's we passed on the cheesecake and the run cake we ordered  6 single items for $ 46.00 and only liked 2 of the items. I don't get the claim of Italian bakery or the prices. If your looking for Italian then go to North beach.
author: Tammi G.

description:
Ok, I love the Cannolis di Ricotta here, always buying at least two when visiting. Even if the shell & filling aren't separated before ordering (tsk tsk), they have the right size, toothsome texture for the shell (a soft crunch) while the filling offers the miniature chocolate chips in a sweetly firm ricotta with traces of vanilla & citrus. No candied orange or lemon peel on top, but the more common cherry kind with the classic dusting of confectioners sugar. Each one about $3.95. 

However, the service here is dreadful, while a wait occurs even if there's no one else in the bakery. Some serious 'tude is common with the servers.  

On a side note, I took these cannolis to Philz down the street & had them with my coffee. I sat outside with my java, and a young homeless man approached me. Seeing what I was eating and inquiring, he offered to trade his bottle of vodka for my cannoli. I turned him down, but for him to wanna give up his alcohol for my cannoli.............
author: Lew A.

description: Best in town. Love the flavor not too sweet just perfect! Must order in advance always! The peach cake is my favorite
author: Linda J.

description:
I am extremely disappointed with this place.  I spent 130 bucks for 40 cupcakes for my son's birthday.  I wanted these cupcakes to be as good as the rest of the food I had lined up.  What a MAJOR disappointment!!  When my husband brought them home they were cold...as if frozen. 

Then I heard from another that they no longer go here because they now freeze items prior to purchase.  These cupcakes were dry and tasteless....the chocolate a little less so.  The frosting was VERY unsatisfying...as if made with Crisco instead of butter.  Hell, even the kids didn't eat them. I wish I would have thought to photograph the voluminous amount of non-eaten cupcakes on abandoned plates and in the garbage.  

Also, 20 were supposed to be white cake with whipped cream on top..but instead all 40 of them had the gross chocolate frosting.   Lame. I did have guests that DIDN'T WANT chocolate!

I am sorry but when you place an order with a bakery YOU EXPECT THEM TO BAKE IT FRESH!!!!!!! And get the order right. I will never go here again.  Used to be great...now tastes like cheap, fake ingredients.  I knew I should have baked them myself.  130 bucks for 40 disgusting cupcakes!!!!!! Really????????
Would gave been happy to pay if they were good...at least we had delicious Mitchell's ice cream on the side...
author: Jana G.

description: My co-workers have brought this to the office a few times and when I finally passed by it in person I just had to check it out. They were closing an hour then it was listed on a yelp but they were closing up so I'm grateful they stayed open a bit longer for us. My friend chose to sample a variety of cookies. You pay for them by pound. They were fairly average but it was a good way to get a sample. I got a custard clam. Basically it's a pastry shell filled with custard. Honestly it was pretty good and I'd probably have it again if I happened to be there but it's nothing i would actively seek out again. Overall, nice place to stop by if you're in the area and have a sweet tooth.
author: Vivian C.

description:
This old SF bakery (32 years) http://s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/C_J0sFjtQfUfrhOEJk5OgA/l.jpg is famous for rum cakes and the St. Honore Cake, a local favorite. But sometimes the attitude of the service can be a turn off for me.

About the St. Honore Cake: in my opinion Victoria Pastry Co. makes a more "elegant" (clean defined layers and less whipped cream) version which some older customers prefer, while Dianda's version looks more traditional. Schubert's version is a decent runner up. Stella Pastry's version has more cake, compared to the others. And the "nazi" pastry chef at Patisserie Delanghe had the best cream puffs, but he retired and closed his shop last year.

There's a nice assortment of cookies, but a bit pricey at $15/lb. http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/JECyfYBuYdx8g1GWNCJs8g/l.jpg Also on display are custom cakes waiting to be picked up. http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/NujufFeRYCk-CAuWqacM3Q/l.jpg For last minute party purchases, consider buying an almond torte or a panetone. http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/h9Y0rA1KHbrgixgav3UueQ/l.jpg

And yes, the pastries are made fresh daily, but the cannoli are pre-filled. That's not proper for cannoli.

Other popular items: I love the Fedoretti ($2.75), http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5aIN1SRRYQ7K9vaAv4-X5w/l.jpg rum flavored chocolate mousse over amaretto cookie (similar to baked marzipan) and covered in dark chocolate; http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fWvL7-kjFk3E3tjpk-LgtQ/l.jpg and the beautiful fruit tarts ($3.75, all pastries). 5 stars for most food items, deducted stars for the -tude service.

Hours: Mon-Sat 6am-6pm, Sun 6am-4:30pm
author: Luis C.

description: While waiting for my burrito at neighboring La Taqueria, I popped into this Italian bakery to check it out and pick up a few items. They have cases full of cakes and cookies, but I spotted my favorite almond pignioli cookies and had to get those. They actually turned out to be pretty good - not as great as my favorite ones in Boston, but still solid. The girl who was helping me was just not super nice - I think she hated her job. I ordered some cookies and when I got home a realized that she given me the wrong ones! Ah well. I got a couple slices of cake and those were also pretty good. I don't think I'll stop by again in the future though, is just rather go somewhere where the service is nicer.
author: caroline y.

description:
I only come here when I am in the area. There are places that are better or the same quality in most parts of town. The prices and everything don't make this place better in anyway. 

What does make this place bad, is the attitude from the people who work here.
author: M C.

description:
Almond tarte is my to go dessert at Diandas
cakes are very delicious too but a little too pricey
author: Liz G.

description: Simply the best. The St, Honore cake is absolutely decadent and to die for!
author: Mike M.

description:
Clap, clap, clap!
The pastries are excellent--cannoli, cream puffs with the rum filling, cakes etc.
Moist, flavorful, not overly sugary, and quality ingredients add up to a guilt free carb binge!
Some friends brought over a large box of assorted pastries last night for our dinner party and this was by far the most authentic tasting Italian pastries I've had in a long time.
Growing up on the east coast and visiting good Italian bakeries plus visiting Italy a few times has trained my taste buds well.
Skip North Beach and head to the Mission.
author: Thomas D.

description: A old fashioned bakery. The torte is amazing. Service is quick. I want to try all the various pastries but they are $4 a piece.
author: Brian C.

description: To Dianda's cake writers: You had one job, one job. Wrote "grandpa" instead of "grandma" on her 80th birthday cake...it took a little bit of creative hiding to rectify the situation, but all was not lost. Also helps that she can't read English, but that's besides the point, haha. That said, the strawberry cake really was quite good. The cake was moist and not too sweet. Large, halved strawberries adorned the cake and it was beautifully presented (minus the typo). Would I order it again? Most definitely.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
WOW - all I can say is NAPOLEON.

I didn't know it could get better than Copenhagen Bakery (Burlingame)  but Dianda's is cheaper, bigger... and better!

All pastries are $3.95.  I'm not a cannoli person but it was pretty good, or one of the better ones that I've had.
author: Melody T.

description:
Talk about Hero to Zero...

I first remember entering Dianda's in the 70's. The signature Almond Torte was so good. Over the years I have had pretty much everything they make. Once upon a time I was there often enough to be a regular, even rated a smile from the counter ladies. I stayed a customer when the original owners sold to the current owners and while there were a few rough patches to get through they managed.

I haven't been there to often in the last year or so, but this weekend my loving Husband stopped in and bought one of those almond cakes and my favorite, a Chocolate Cherry cake.

WHAT a disappointment.

The Almond Torte wasn't bad. But it was a bit dry, and seemed to have less almond paste than previously.

But that Chocolate Cherry cake? That was just beyond bad. The cherries, which were previously tart sweet and tasted of cherry, have been replaced with an artificial tasting cherry filling. The thick whipped cream based filling and frosting is now a gross greasy frosting/buttercream with a shortening base. Yuck. The chocolate ganache has been replaced with an overly sweet chocolate coloured icing.

The quality of ingredients has taken a HUGE hit recently. And the taste has too.

Just bad news all around. Man am I sad : -(
author: Sara D.

description: super cute italian bakeshop! i got the vanilla nepolean and it was perfectly layered and delicious - not super sweet! would come again!
author: Christina L.

description: This bakery is absolutely fabulous. Every time I come to the mission, it is absolutely necessary for me to stop by for pastries and cookies. Their cookies are always fresh and delicious, their croissants are amazing, and their cakes are great. The ladies working there are always warm and polite. This place is a true gem.
author: Omar J.

description: I love their great selection of desserts. Theres so many cakes as well as cookies to choose from. It's hard deciding on what to get! I got a slice of black forest cake, and it was pretty good!  A little sweet for my taste but no complaints!
author: Carmen C.

description: I've been here many times for their cookies, pastry and cakes. I ordered a mango tres leche cake on Sunday. It looked amazing but sadly it was not moist. It was flavorful but lacked that authentic tres leche moistness and flavor.
author: Robert O.

description: I loved this bakery almost 30 years ago growing up in SF- the quality, the taste, the originality, and everything else that made their pastries delicious and incomparable! Even still, to this day, their quality and delicious pastries are just as amazing as they were back then! I go out of my way to come here when I'm in town visiting.
author: L M.

description: Ran into this this little historical gem while walking & shopping the Mission.  What a delight!  We tried the cupcakes, and several cookies, all fabulous.  The gorgeous cases of goodness are every bit as beautiful as the cases in Paris.
author: Chris H.

description: Cakes are really good!! I ordered the tres leches with banana, it was delicious!! A little pricey but good
author: Rosa R.

description:
The chocolate cake slice that I bought for my honey and I to celebrate out 10 year anniversary month was very tasty.  The creme was filled with a slight tasty of rum.   The cake was light and flavorful. It was a perfect cap to the evening on the Sunday with leftover to eat in the morning.

My partner thought the buttercream frosting was too heavy, but I thought it was good. I would come back again to try another slice of cake that they have or other pastries.
author: Marck N.

description:
Well today I bough my daughters birthday cake 
We use to buy at this place all my family cakes birthdays 
But the past tree cakes tres leches are not that good as they use to be 
Today I was trying to get chocolate one but was sold out and I was going to ask for the peach  one but the sales lady said we have pineapple too and have this square cake , I ask which one is most  delicious she recommended. Pineapple well I believe but this is the worst cake I had from diandas  last one  was ok but today nobody of my family liked the cake  I paid $70 dollars for it 75% cake went to trash  I'm very disappointed. 
The cake had way too much pineapple syrup fill way too much almost all inside was the pineapple thing too sweet  the bread stuff  was like 1 centimeter on tap and bottom !
author: Emilia E.

description: Bad customer service woman just go with friends or men they like in order to proceed faster check out the blonde hispanic woman in the morning had bad service and attitude and the other female that made my chocolate made my chocolate taste like shit coffee is mpre sweetened then their chocolate here bad service for a coffee bakery shop save a dollar and go to peets or starbucks
author: David R.

description: So many delicious looking cookies and pastries here! When you first walk in, you'll see the cutest petit fours in the display case. They don't look like mini cakes at all... more like realistic plastic display models. They're in a variety of pastel colors and decorations. They're on the expensive side, though, $2.50 each. Comparatively, their cakes are $3.95 each, and each slice is humongous! Their cookies by the pound ($16.95 per pound) look amazing too. There are a variety of butter, sugar, and chocolate dipped cookies.
author: Sherry L.

description:
God bless St. Honoré.

I know nothing about this Saint except the following:

"St. Honoré Cake is named for the French patron saint of bakers and pastry chefs, Saint Honoré or Honoratus (d. 600 AD), bishop of Amiens.  This classic french dessert is a circle of puff pastry at its base with a ring of pâte à choux piped on the outer edge. After the base is baked small cream puffs are dipped in caramelized sugar and attached side by side on top of the circle of the pâte à choux. This base is traditionally filled with crème chiboust and finished with whipped cream using a special St. Honore piping tip."

(I loves me some Wikipedia.)

Where can you get this classic French dessert?  Why at an Italian bakery in the Mission of course!  If you cut into a slice of their St. Honoré Cake, you'll bite into a strong rum flavored cream in the center, pastry with crunchy bits of caramelized sugar on the bottom, a creme puff border on the outside, and whipped cream on top of it all.  If you aren't a fan of cream puffs, Dianda's has loads of other treats to keep your sweet tooth satisfied.  I am partial to their Italian cookies, especially the addictive almond flavored amaretti.

Also, copious sugar filled blessings on Daniel L. who preaches the gospel of Dianda's luscious St. Honoré Cake.

(Talk about a saint!)
author: Amy C.

description:
"Leave the gun.  Take the Connolis."  is the famous line that Peter Clemenza said in the movie ' The Godfather '.  

With my fascination with mafia movies, along with my eyes fixated on the counter that is filled with Italian Pastries, those words came to mind.  Looking at all the pastries was to me, like looking at a bouquet of flowers.  Absolutely beautiful in appearance.  The sweet smell of fresh baked pastries.  I didn't know where to start, I wanted it all.  Like a kid in a candy store.  Or should I say a fat kid in a bakery.

I had to get a connoli, rum cake, napolen cake, amaretti cookies, and a couple other cakes that I don't remember the name of but were amazing nonetheless.  

So if I'm Clemenza, I would have said "Leave the gun, take the connolis, rum cake, amaretti cookies, and all the cakes filled with flaky, custardy, sweet goodness."
author: Michael L.

description:
Old School Italian Bakery....the BEST!!!!!!   Don't go to North Beach, just head to the Mission.

To Die For ....Authentic cannolis & Napoleons! They have cookies (sold by the pound) that are so delish!!!!  I've had & ordered their St. Honore Cake for special occasion, truly AMAZING!!!!!

Some people say its a little pricey here. I say ITS DEFINITELY WORTH IT.

Parking can be challenging.  As I said, sooooo worth it!
author: Janet T.

description:
$4 for all pastries - better than north beach. went here this past friday to grab some pastries for my fiance's birthday. I wasn't expecting to find an italian bakery in the middle of mission but its convienently located right off the 24th st bart so its easy to get to. 

its a pretty nice sized store with a variety of different cookies, pastries, and also pies. I got a slice of  napolean, tiramisu, rum cake, and their popular canoli. the lady helping me was very nice and patient providing some advice as well. I didn't try all the dessert but I did have a sliver of the tiramisu and it was really good. the cake wasn't super soggy and nice balance of coffee. the rest of the desserts lasted until dinner as well and everyone said thye were really good. the pastry was flaky and very flavorful. the rum cake was rather strong too.

Also they take CC and if you call, they will put aside pieces for you! oh and for your price you pay, you get a nice big slice or portion.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
You can have your cake and eat it, too!

For better or worse, you can buy by the slice which means you don't need 'special' occasions to nom some fruit and whipped cream between fluffy layers of cake.

On days you're feeling less indulgent, opt for cookies (sold by the pound) all labeled with any dietary need you have - dairy free, nut free, gluten free etc.

Open early (6:00 during the week), I used to pop in for a morning coffee.

Now, it's on the way home that I'm tempted. The biscotti are just too good, if there ever were such a thing.
author: Alissa A.

description:
Delicious italian cookies that I don't remember the names of. Nor was I able to pronounce them correctly!!

My favorite was their meringues - so airy and literally melts in your mouth. All the cookies are sold by the pound at around $17/lb. 

Wonderful to pair with coffee. 

PS - it would be nice if the cashiers smiled
author: Tina C.

description: We're always looking for an excuse to buy their raspberry almond tarts, and during the festive season, there are lots of get-togethers and potlucks that warrant a trip to the store for these babies.  And they are a hit every. single. time.
author: Ange L.

description: I can't get enough of the Tres Leches cake with strawberries.  And I'm not a big strawberry person.  But the fruit is a sideline player in this rich, dense, incredibly moist delicacy.  I ordered a cake for 35 - 50 people and couldn't carry it out, it was so heavy.  But a robust, behemoth of a helpful woman lifted it like it was a kleenex and whisked it out to my car.
